publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-494 Mr Mark Ruskell: Welsh Assembly Stance on GM—That the Parliament applauds the stance of the National Assembly for Wales and the Minister for Environment, Planning and Countryside in Wales, Carwyn Jones AM in adopting the "most restrictive policy possible" over GM crops regardless of the position of Her Majesty’s Government and calls on the Minister for Environment and Rural Development to adopt the same position as his Welsh counterpart to safeguard the future of Scottish food and farming. Supported by: Mark Ballard*
S2M-494 Welsh Assembly Stance on GM (lodged on 10 October 2003) Patrick Harvie*, Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-494 Welsh Assembly Stance on GM (lodged on 10 October 2003) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Shiona Baird*, Robin Harper*, Rosie Kane*, Eleanor Scott*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-494 Welsh Assembly Stance on GM (lodged on 10 October 2003) Chris Ballance*
S2M-494 Welsh Assembly Stance on GM (lodged on 10 October 2003) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-494 Welsh Assembly Stance on GM (lodged on 10 October 2003) Mr Rob Gibson*
S2M-494 Welsh Assembly Stance on GM (lodged on 10 October 2003) Dr Jean Turner*
